question:
Competitive SIS model over two multiplex layer A and B same set of nodes. the two memes are exclusive: A node cannot adopt meme 1 and meme 2 simultaneously. Beta 1 and delta 1 for layer 1 and beta2 and delta 2 for layer 2 Assume the effective adoption rates of each meme are larger than their no-sharing mean field threshold, i.e., ðœ1>1/ðœ†1(ð´) and ðœ2>1/ðœ†1(ðµ).Question1-:  Will both memes survive (coexistence), or will one meme completely remove the other (absolute dominance)?2-which characteristics of a multilayer network structure allow for coexistence?
 This question need to be addressed analytically and then simulated to see if the analytical solutions are also valid by simualtion comprehensively.
 please do not ask the user any question, use other tools to address the question
next_plan:
1. Finish Discovery phase formally: pull literature on competing epidemics/memes on multiplex networks to cite.
2. Provide analytical derivation of equilibrium and stability using mean-field NIMFA, derive coexistence conditions.
3. Perform parameter sweep simulations varying beta1 and beta2, plus varying layer overlap (by rewiring) to test structural effects.
4. Analyze results across parameter grid producing heatmaps of final prevalence for each meme.
5. Compile metrics and produce comprehensive analysis section.
6. Draft full LaTeX paper with sections, include figures and tables.
7. Deliver final report with bibliography.

2. Summarize simulation results (metrics, heatmap) indicating observed dominance patterns.
3. Draft full LaTeX paper with references (Sahneh2014, VanMieghem2009, BiVirus2023, etc.) ensuring bibitem entries.
4. Compile all sections.
